newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Volvo says U.S. March car sales fall 2pct.
newsitem.headline: Volvo says U.S. March car sales fall 2pct.

text.p: Swedish automotive group AB Volvo said on Tuesday its U.S. car sales fell two percent to 8,116 cars in March from the same month a year earlier.
So far this year, Volvo's U.S. car sales have dipped to 24,247 from 24,450 cars in the same period last year, Volvo spokesman Ingmar Hesslefors told Reuters.
Figures to date do not include sales of Volvo's new model range S70/V70 which will be launched in the U.S. in April.
The company's Canadian car sales rose 12.9 percent to 702 cars in March, boosting total sales in the country so far in 1997 to 2,072 cars, which is a 12.5 percent increase from a year earlier.
